newsitem.title: LATVIA: FOREIGNERS TO GET 33 PCT STAKE IN LATVENERGO.
newsitem.headline: FOREIGNERS TO GET 33 PCT STAKE IN LATVENERGO.

text.p: Foreign strategic investors will be offered a 33.33 percent stake in state electricity company Latvenergo, the privatisation agency said on Wednesday.
The agency earlier announced the restructuring of Latvenergo into a holding company to control four generating companies.

Strategic investors will be offered a 33.33 percent stake in the holding company, 7.8 percent will be offered to employees and retirees and some 15 percent will sold in a public offer, the agency said in a statement.
Some 11.11 percent of Latvenergo shares will be sold for vouchers and 3.70 will go into cash privatisation.
"The state will maintain a 55 percent controlling stake in the generating stations and the high-voltage grid for the foreseeable future," Naglis said.
The state stake will not be reduced below 51 percent at least for the next three years.
The agency said it expected a valuation of the company in the second half of July at the soonest as the audit results will only be ready on July 1.
"The share price can be clear only after talks with strategic investors," Naglis said.
